title: Isaac Newton: Matter, Math, and Motion
description: From a young age, Isaac Newton had always been curious about the world around him. He dedicated his life to learning why things are the way they are. Isaac Newton: Matter, Math, and Motion provides students a look into Sir Isaac Newton's life and the discoveries he made. The book can also be used to teach students how to identify cause-and-effect relationships and recognize and use prepositional phrases.
meta: calculations, interacted, intrigued, isolation, lecture, mint, momentum, physics, politican, ponder, refine, scathing
Cause and Effect : Determine cause-and-effect relationships
Prepositional Phrases : Recognize and use prepositional phrases
Syllable Patterns : Recognize and identify syllable patterns within a word

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
